datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to ethics, metaphysics, and philosophical arguments.

columns.name: topic_of_debate
columns.description: The main ethical topic discussed during the debate

columns.name: percentage_increase_in_utilitarianism
columns.description: Percentage increase in participants advocating for utilitarianism in a moderated format compared to an unmoderated format

columns.name: number_of_philosophical_articles
columns.description: The count of philosophical articles published in the month before the debate.

columns.name: number_of_philosophical_books_sold
columns.description: Count of philosophical books sold in the month prior to the debate.

columns.name: ethics_philosopher_present
columns.description: Indicates whether a professional ethics philosopher is present as a speaker

columns.name: moderator_ethical_stance
columns.description: Categorical value reflecting the ethical stance of the debate moderator, such as 'utilitarian', 'deontological', or 'virtue_ethics'.

columns.name: critical_event_occurred
columns.description: Binary flag indicating whether a critical event that could sway participants' opinions occurred during the debate.

columns.name: external_temperature
columns.description: The outdoor temperature in degrees Celsius during the debate

columns.name: average_debate_duration
columns.description: Average duration of debates in minutes.

columns.name: number_of_sessions
columns.description: The total number of debate sessions.

columns.name: monthly_attendance_rate
columns.description: Percentage of seats filled at philosophical debate seminars each month.

columns.name: audience_interest_level
columns.description: Numerical value representing audience's interest in philosophical topics, scaled 1 to 10.

columns.name: day_of_week
columns.description: The day of the week on which the debate is scheduled

columns.name: argument_intensity
columns.description: Numerical value representing the intensity of arguments used during the debate, where higher values indicate more intense debates.

columns.name: philosophical_topic
columns.description: Type of philosophical topic being discussed in the debate

columns.name: month_of_debate
columns.description: Month when the debate occurred extracted from the full date

columns.name: number_of_participants
columns.description: Total number of participants in the debate

columns.name: keynote_speaker_present
columns.description: Indicates whether a keynote speaker is present during the debate session

queries.question: What is the relationship between argument intensity, moderator's ethical stance, audience interest level, average debate duration, number of sessions, and the occurrence of critical events in philosophical debates focused on ethics, and the resulting percentage increase in utilitarianism advocated by participants?
